fields.descriptive_line: Fred Roe. Coffer in Saltwood Church, Kent. c.1300. Drawing for illustration to Ancient Coffers and Cupboards (Methuen & Co., London, 1902). Pencil.
fields.title: Coffer in Saltwood Church, Kent; Ancient Coffers and Cupboards
fields.location: Prints & Drawings Study Room, level D, case 94, shelf G, box 41
Prints & Drawings Study Room, level D

fields.name: Prints & Drawings Study Room, level D

fields.bibliography: Victoria and Albert Museum, Department of Engraving, Illustration and Design & Department of Paintings, Accessions 1947, London: HMSO, 1950. The full text of the record is as follows: 'ROE, Fred, R.I. (1864-1947) Drawings (34) for Ancient Coffers and Cupboards, written and illustrated by Fred Roe, and published by Messrs. Methuen & Co., London, 1902. Signed Fred Roe and dated variously from 1898 to 1901. Each inscribed with text and some with measurements. Water-colour (E.543 & E.551), Indian ink (E.550 & E.553) and pencil. E.543 - 576-1947 Given by Mr F. Gordon Roe, F.S.A., son of the artist. Frontispiece: Painted Coffer (formerly in the Court of Chancery, Durham). 14th century. E.543-1947 Page 3 Coffer in the Victoria & Albert Museum. (No.733-1895). 13th century. E.544-1947 7 Anglo-Saxon Casket of Whalebone in the British Museum. 8th century. E.545-1947 11 Armoire at Aubazine, Corrèze, France. Late 12th or early 13th century. E.546-1947 17 Coffer in the Author's Collection. Late 13th century. E.547-1947 21 Coffer in Graveney Church, Kent. 13th century. E.548-1947 24 Coffer in Stoke d'Abernon Church, Surrey. 13th century. E.549-1947 25 Coffer in Climping Church, Sussex, (as it appeared in 1836, before the removal of the feet). Late 13th century. E.550-1947 26 Painted Coffer in Newport Church, Essex. 13th century. E.551-1947 27 Coffer in the Musée de Cluny. Paris. Late 13th century. E.552-1947 29 Armoire in the Sacristy of Bayeux Cathedral, France. 13th century. E.553-1947 31 Painted Armoire in Noyon Cathedral, France. Late 13th century. E.554-1947 34 Coffer in Saltwood Church, Kent. c.1300. E.555-1947 37 Coffer, known as the "Jewel Chest" in St. Mary Magdalene's Church, Oxford. 14th century. E.556-1947 41 Coffer in Faversham Church, Kent. 14th century. E.557-1947 45 Coffer in Chevington Church, Suffolk. 14th century. E.558-1947 49 Coffret in the Author's Collection. 14th century. E.559-1947 53 Coffer in the vestry of York Minster. Late 14th century. E.560-1947 57 Tilting Coffer in Harty Church, Isle of Sheppey, Kent. Early 13th century. E.561-1947 61 Tilting Coffret in the Victoria & Albert Museum (No. 738-1895). Early 15th century. E.562-1947 65 Tilting Coffer in the Musée de Cluny, Paris. French, late 15th or early 16th century. E.563-1947 73 Chest in the Author's Collection. German, 15th century. E.564-1947 77 Chest front in the Author's Collection. Flemish, late 15th century. E.565-1947 81 "Flanders Chest" in Southwold Church, Suffolk. End of 15th century. E.566-1947 86, 87 Cupboard in Minehead Church, Somerset (obverse and reverse). Flemish, 15th century. E.567, 568-1947 89 Armoire in York Minster. 15th century. E.569-1947 93 Chest in the collection of the Hon. Justice Eady. French, 15th century. E.570-1947 95 Cupboard, known as "Sudbury's Hutch", in Louth Church, Lincolnshire. 15th century. E.571-1947 101 Almery (late Gothic) in the collection of Mr. Morgan Williams, St. Donat's Castle, Glamorganshire. Early 16th century. . E.572-1947 105 Credence in the collection of Mr. Edward Barry, Ockwells Manor, Berkshire. Early 16th century. E.573-1947 107 Cupboard in the collection of Mr. Edward Barry, Ockwells Manor, Berkshire. English, early 16th century. E.574-1947 109 "Flanders Chest" in East Dereham Church, Norfolk. 16th century. E.575-1947 122 Coffer in Attlesborough Church, Norfolk. 16th century. E.576-1947' Fred Roe, Ancient Coffers and Cupboards, Methuen & Co, London, 1902.
fields.credit: Given by Mr F. Gordon Roe, F.S.A., son of the artist.
